definitions.definition: To remove the fleece from (a sheep , llama , etc.) by clipping .
To cut the hair of (a person).
examples: shear the afro off someone's head

definitions.definition: To cut , originally with a sword or other bladed weapon, now usually with shears , or as if using shears.
To deform because of forces pushing in opposite directions .
To change in direction or speed .
To transform by displacing every point in a direction parallel to some given line by a distance proportional to the point’s distance from the line.
To make a vertical cut in coal .
To break or suddenly separate because of excessive force , eg. a bolt.
To deprive of property ; to fleece .

main_definition: ( intransitive , transitive ) To remove the fleece from (a sheep , llama , etc.) by clipping .
secondary_definitions: To cut the hair of (a person).
To cut , originally with a sword or other bladed weapon, now usually with shears , or as if using shears.
( physics ) To deform because of forces pushing in opposite directions .
( aviation , meteorology , intransitive , of wind ) To change in direction or speed .
( mathematics ) To transform by displacing every point in a direction parallel to some given line by a distance proportional to the point’s distance from the line.
( mining , intransitive ) To make a vertical cut in coal .
( engineering ) (also 'shear off') To break or suddenly separate because of excessive force , eg. a bolt.
( figurative ) To deprive of property ; to fleece .
